sen.j: 母は班子女王、宇多天皇は同母兄にあたる。
sen.e: Her mother was Princess Hanshi, and elder brother-uterine was Emperor Uda.

sen.e: On May 11, 884, she was demoted from nobility to subject with his elder brother, Prince Sadami (later Emperor Uda), and was given the Minamoto clan Asomi.

sen.e: At the same time as when Emperor Daigo ascended the throne in 897, she entered into the court, and became a princess following the empress (the position of empress was not established at this time).

sen.j: 宇多上皇は阿衡事件の教訓から藤原北家嫡流を外祖父とする皇子の出生を望まず、為子所生の男子を立太子する方針であった。
sen.e: The Retired Emperor Uda who learned from the Ako Incident did not desire a birth of prince whose maternal grandfather was from the main branch of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, and intended to formlly install a son of Tameko as a Crown Prince.

sen.j: このため、為子の次の后として藤原時平の妹藤原穏子を入内させようとした醍醐天皇・藤原時平とこれに反対する宇多上皇との対立が発生（『九暦』）し、後の宇多上皇による斉世親王の皇位継承者指名問題及び菅原道真の大宰権帥左遷事件（いわゆる昌泰の変）に発生したとも言われている。
sen.e: Therefore, Emperor Daigo and FUJIWARA no Tokihira who intended to have FUJIWARA no Onshi, younger sister of FUJIWARA no Tokihira, enter into the court as the next empress of Tameko conflicted with the Retired Emperor Uda who made an objection against it ("Kyureki" (diary of FUJIWARA no Morosue), and it is said that this conflict developed to the later problem that the Retired Emperor Uda has designated Imperial Prince Tokiyo as the heir to the Imperial Throne, and to an incident of demotion of SUGAWARA no Michizane, Dazai gon no sochi (Provisional Governor-General of the Dazai-fu offices) (so-called the Shotai incident).
